body:
I can't reproduce this on macOS, will also try Linux.

Could you perhaps turn this into a self-contained script and make sure to add the `--nohome_rc --nosystem_rc` startup flags?

@fmeum I tried to add `--nohome_rc --nosystem_rc`, didn't help. I attached archive with Bazel project and `script.sh` script what performs mentioned commands. 

[inject_repo_sample.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22515695/inject_repo_sample.zip)

This is actually expected: The particular action that reruns pretty prints a label, which requires the repo mapping of the root module and that is affected by injecting a new repo. I think that we can do better though, let me take a look.
It wasn't happening with Bazel 7 because in < 8 we use `--override_repository` instead of `--inject_repository`

issue.title: Improve action key computation for command lines with `Label`s

labels.name: team-Configurability
labels.description: platforms, toolchains, cquery, select(), config transitions

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
This avoids rerunning an action when the main repo mapping changes in unrelated ways, for example because a new repo is added.

Clean up one unnecessary `null` check on `mainRepositoryMapping`.

Fixes #27061

issue.title: [8.5.0] Improve action key computation for command lines with `Label`s

This avoids rerunning an action when the main repo mapping changes in unrelated ways, for example because a new repo is added.

Clean up one unnecessary `null` check on `mainRepositoryMapping`.

Fixes #27061

Closes #27081.
